quizzes.question: What would occur if we forget to include a break statement at the end of case code?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The break Statement[/h1]

The role of the [b]break [/b]statement is to terminate the [b]switch [/b]statement.
Without it, execution continues past the matching [b]case [/b]statements and falls through to the next case statements, even when the case labels donâ€™t match the switch variable. 
This behavior is called [b]fallthrough [/b]and modern C# compilers will not compile such code. All case and default code must end with a [b]break [/b]statement.
[note]The [b]break [/b]statement can also be used to break out of a loop. You will learn about loops in the coming lessons.[/note]
